Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Padiefenbastet with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard (chipped) and crossed hands in relief holding an adze, a hoe and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the leg section is inscribed with five (remaining) rows of Hieroglyphs; back-pillar; the lower leg section is lost.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Saqqara (Memphis), H5-499 Pit by south wall, sector 1, temple terrace
